DataElement.preferredName: AIDS-Related Kaposi Sarcoma Tumor Extent Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Term to describe the disease stage for an individual with AIDS-related Kaposi's sarcoma, using the AIDS Clinical Trials group staging classification to evaluate extent of tumor present.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The most aggressive form of Kaposi sarcoma.  It presents in patients who are infected with the human immunodeficiency virus.  It can affect the skin and internal organs._Refers to the number of cancer cells, the size of a tumor, or the amount of cancer in the body._The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The most aggressive form of Kaposi sarcoma.  It presents in patients who are infected with the human immunodeficiency virus.  It can affect the skin and internal organs.

Concepts.definition: The most aggressive form of Kaposi sarcoma. It presents in patients who are infected with the human immunodeficiency virus. It can affect the skin and internal organs.

Property.preferredDefinition: Refers to the number of cancer cells, the size of a tumor, or the amount of cancer in the body. Also called tumor load.:The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

Concepts.definition: Refers to the number of cancer cells, the size of a tumor, or the amount of cancer in the body.
The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: AIDS-Related Kaposi Sarcoma Tumor Extent Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The most aggressive form of Kaposi sarcoma.  It presents in patients who are infected with the human immunodeficiency virus.  It can affect the skin and internal organs._Refers to the number of cancer cells, the size of a tumor, or the amount of cancer in the body. Also called tumor load._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: AIDS-related Kaposi sarcoma involving the esophagus, stomach, or intestines.

Concepts.longName: AIDS-Related Kaposi Sarcoma T1 (Poor Risk): Gastrointestinal Tract Involvement
Concepts.definition: AIDS-related Kaposi sarcoma involving the esophagus, stomach, or intestines.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: AIDS-related Kaposi sarcoma with lesions that are nodular and/or lesions in roof of the mouth.

Concepts.longName: AIDS-Related Kaposi Sarcoma T1 (Poor Risk): Extensive Oral Involvement
Concepts.definition: AIDS-related Kaposi sarcoma with lesions that are nodular and/or lesions in roof of the mouth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: AIDS-related Kaposi sarcoma is only in the skin and/or the lymph nodes, and/or there is only a small amount of disease on the palate. The Kaposi sarcoma lesions in the mouth are flat rather than raised. (American Cancer Society)

Concepts.longName: AIDS-Related Kaposi Sarcoma T0 (Good Risk): Localized Tumor
Concepts.definition: AIDS-related Kaposi sarcoma is only in the skin and/or the lymph nodes, and/or there is only a small amount of disease on the palate. The Kaposi sarcoma lesions in the mouth are flat rather than raised. (American Cancer Society)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: AIDS-related Kaposi sarcoma with edema or ulceration due to the tumor.

Concepts.longName: AIDS-Related Kaposi Sarcoma T1 (Poor Risk): Edema or Ulceration
Concepts.definition: AIDS-related Kaposi sarcoma with edema or ulceration due to the tumor.

PermissibleValues.value: T1 - KS in other non-nodal viscera
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: T1 - KS in other non-nodal viscera

ValueMeaning.preferredName: T1 - KS in other non-nodal viscera
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: AIDS-related Kaposi sarcoma involving organs other than the lungs or gastrointestinal tract. It includes liver, bladder, reproductive tract, heart, and endocrine organs.

Concepts.longName: AIDS-Related Kaposi Sarcoma T1 (Poor Risk): Other Non-Nodal Viscera Involvement
Concepts.definition: AIDS-related Kaposi sarcoma involving organs other than the lungs or gastrointestinal tract. It includes liver, bladder, reproductive tract, heart, and endocrine organs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: AIDS-related Kaposi sarcoma involving the lungs.

Concepts.longName: AIDS-Related Kaposi Sarcoma T1 (Poor Risk): Pulmonary Involvement
Concepts.definition: AIDS-related Kaposi sarcoma involving the lungs.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: AIDS-Related Kaposi Sarcoma Tumor Burden Stage
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The most aggressive form of Kaposi sarcoma.  It presents in patients who are infected with the human immunodeficiency virus.  It can affect the skin and internal organs.:Refers to the number of cancer cells, the size of a tumor, or the amount of cancer in the body. Also called tumor load.:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: The most aggressive form of Kaposi sarcoma. It presents in patients who are infected with the human immunodeficiency virus. It can affect the skin and internal organs.
Refers to the number of cancer cells, the size of a tumor, or the amount of cancer in the body.
The extent of a cancer in the body.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: v2.0 increases max length from 2 to 42 characters 6.13.17 v3.0 changes concept annotation of VM to precoordinated concepts. mc

DataElement.origin: ACTG TIS Classification:AIDS Clinical Trials Group staging classification for AIDS-associated Kaposi's sarcoma
DataElement.changeDescription: Curated for NCI CCR trial; v2.0 replaces v1.0 with reworked Value domain and permissible value set 6.13.17 v3.0 includes precoordinated concept annotation for VMs plus 1 additional PV. mc
